channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report I-2024100067
item.description:
Report I-2024100067

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T09:15:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: DULLES
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An FAs link was discovered missing just before departure. During flight after the initial beverage service. The link was found in the back of an oven while meals were being loaded for service. Link was removed safely from the oven using gloves then covered with water(had to be removed to soak as it was not reachable bottle and was not smoking or on fire). Link was allowed to cool in a water bath. The device was last placed in the BSO closet, where they keep Hazardous Materials. It's been tagged with the DG case number and is currently still there.

item.title: Report E-2024100328
item.description:
Report E-2024100328

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: FOREST
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was attempting to make a delivery at a customer site when they had an equipment malfunction. The ball valve in the vapor recovery malfunctioned resulting in a product release of approximately 10 gallons. CDG managed the spill cleanup. Our customer is going to reimburse Eagle for the cleanup related to this event due to their equipment malfunction.

item.title: Report E-2024100327
item.description:
Report E-2024100327

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-22
  • City: WINCHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver arrived at the customer site and attempted to drop product in the wrong tank resulting in an overfill and product release. Product reached the ground. Estimated 10 gallons. CDG managed the spill cleanup.
